partintro.para: The RLS Administration Tool (globus-rls-admin) performs administrative operations on a RLS server

The RLS Client Tool (globus-rls-cli) provides a command line interface to some of the functions supported by RLS. It also supports an interactive interface (if command is not specified). In interactive move double quotes may be used to encode an argument that contains white space.
The RLS server (globus-rls-server) can be configured as either or both of the following:

listitem.simpara:
Location Replica Catalog (LRC) server, which manages Logical FileName (LFN) to Physical FileName (PFN) mappings in a database.
Note: If globus-rls-server is configured as an LRC server, the RLI servers that it sends updates to should be added to the database using globus-rls-admin.
Replica Location Index (RLI) server, which manages mappings of LFNs to LRC servers.

partintro.para: Clients wishing to locate one or more physical filenames associated with a logical filename should first contact an RLI server, which will return a list of LRCs that may know about the LFN. The LRC servers are then contacted in turn to find the physical filenames.
Note: RLI information may be out of date, so clients should be prepared to get a negative response when contacting an LRC (or no response at all if the LRC server is unavailable.)

refsect1.title: Synopsis
refsect1.para: -A|-a|-C option value|-c option|-d|-e|-p|-q|-s|-t timeout|-u|-v [ rli ] [ pattern ] [ server ]

entry.para: Adds rli to list of RLI servers updated by an LRC server using Bloom filters.

Note: Partitions are not supported with Bloom filters, the LRC server maintains one Bloom filter for all LFNs in its database, which is sent to all RLI servers configured to receive Bloom filter updates with this option.
Adds rli and optionally pattern to the list of RLI servers that the LRC server sends updates to (using a list of LFNs).
If pattern is specified, then only LFNs matching it will be sent to rli.
If rli is added with no patterns, then it is sent all updates. Pattern matching is done using standard Unix file globbing.
Important: This does not update the configuration file. Tthe next time the server is restarted, the configuration change will be lost.
Retrieves configuration value for specified option from server.
If option is set to all, then all options are retrieved.
Removes rli and pattern from list of RLI servers that the LRC server sends updates to.
If pattern is not specified, then all entries for rli are removed.
Note: If all patterns are removed separately, then rli is sent all updates. To stop any updates from being sent to rli, do not specify pattern

row.entry: Clears LRC database. Removes all lfn,pfn mappings.
Verifies that the server is responding.

entry.para: Shows statistics and other information gathered by RLS server.
Intended to be input into GRIS.
Shows list of RLI servers and patterns being sent updates by the LRC server.
If rli or pattern are not specified, they are considered wildcards.
Sets timeout (in seconds) for RLS server requests.

row.entry: Causes LRC server to immediately start full softstate updates to any RLI servers previously added with the -a option.
